intro: Chiloschista himalaica, commonly known as the Himalayan chiloschista, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and often aromatic, while its flowers bloom in early summer. Chiloschista himalaica is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude ecosystems.
